alex golightly: shutupshutupshutup

So, yeah.  I have not posted for 223 days.  Or 7 months, 11 days, 16 hours, 11 minutes, 21 seconds.  Or 31 weeks.  Or 5368 hours.  Or 322,091 minutes.  Or 19,325,481 seconds.  Ok, I'm done.  That is a long time.  I apologize.  So what have you been doing in that 7 months, 11 days, 16 ho... sorry.  Here's a super quick rundown: nothing.  Abso-fucking-lutely nothing.  I've been working and that's about it.  So that's that for my past.

I was looking through my friends pages just now and I have come to one of two realizations:  Only 3 people post on Live Journal or I don't have any friends.  Either way, it's sad for me.

So this is my majestic return to Live Journal.  Eat it.
So I got it, bitches.  And I'll be the best damn Ass. Man. Starbucks ever had.
In the past week I've discovered crotch holes in two separate pair of boxer briefs.
I am such a baby when I'm sick.

I have a 1 year warranty on my iPod.  Meaning I can bring it to the Apple Store and they'll fix it for free.  Unless, of course, they figure out* I've dropped it 95325632495634956325963295325932.  ::crosses fingers::

CD's GALORE!  Lupe Fiasco, Guster, and Obie Trice all "drop" albums next week.  I'm really, really excited for the Lupe Fiasco album.  I can't get "Kick Push" out of my head (or mp3 player).  I have the feeling for him that I had when I first heard Brick by Ben Folds Five, and I had only heard, literally, 8 seconds of it.  Guster - how could I NOT be excited for them.  They have yet to dissapoint.  Chaddy P. hooked it up with the burned copy, but Guster is a band I will always support.  And Obie Trice's first album, Cheers, is outstanding and I would like to think the the sophomore effort will be, as we say in the streets, off the chizzle.

I go into the city to panel for the promotion August 6.  I am nervous as fuck.  BUT if I do well (like I plan to) then I start making more money that day.  So everyone wish me luck for the next month.  And then when I'm rolling in the dough I shall through a party at my nice, new apartment and anyone who wished me luck can come.  Except for you.

Ok, wow, this post really sucks.  I apologize.

Night, firecrackers.







*They kinda figured out that I dropped it.  I have to take it back to see if it's covered by the warranty.  I'm assuming the answer is "no".

1.Go into your LJ's archives.
2.Find your 23rd post (or closest to).
3.Find the fifth sentence (or closest to).
4.Post the text of the sentence as a link in your blog along with these instructions.


"Most guys' hang to the right or the left."

On the way home from my 45943750932450327532y32535jgy43q2 hour shift, I heard Do You Believe In Magic, by The Lovin' Spoonfuls.  I fucking love that song.  So simple, so happy, so good.  And it sounds like it was a bunch of guys from Philly who just got together and made a song just for the hell of it.  Why Philly?  You got me.  Why I felt it so urgent that I needed to post this immediately?  You got me twice.



And does anyone else think the title "The Lovin' Spoonfuls" sounds absurdly pervy?

Night, cumbuckets.

John Brown's Body is pretty much the best band you'll ever hear.  Just thought I'd tell you that.  To everyone I know in Rochester and Buffalo, you should go see them at the end of this month.  I promise you won't be disappointed. I have one of their albums shared on AIM.  

So, wow.    Derek and Brenna broke up last night.  I kinda feel bad about posting about it, but it's affecting me a lot more than it should.  Like, they were Derek And Brenna, you know?   I remember right before Brenna moved to Buffalo.  She had come out to visit for a week or so and when she went back he told me "I'm probably going to marry her".  I don't even know if he told anyone else that.  From what I know this is only their second time having major problems, and they're too good to not be together, so I'm assuming they'll go their seperate ways for however long, and then realize that they need to be together for my sake, and that will be that.  Derek, I love you.  And your huge wang.    

So my boss wants me to be a boss (hooray!!).  And today, her boss talked to me about being a boss (double hooray!!!!)  And it might happen as soon as...a year (Boo!).  But I can wait out a year.  And a year is worst-case.  Maybe I can start the program at the end of the summer.  And by mid-spring, I can move ANYWHERE.  I'm thinking Southern California.  2 of my best peoples are there.  Whatever.  I have plenty of time to think about it.  

Ok, so apparently Sean and Teresa also broke up.  What the fuck is going on?  Who's next?  Not be be selfish, but I had wedding outfits already planned out guys.  Where am I going to wear these things now?   Think of me!  I was gonna scam major tail at these weddings.  Now ::sigh:: ...I have 2 words: hook.ers.  You happy?  OK, that was kinda mean, but seriously everyone, stop breaking up.  It makes you sad, which makes me sad, which SHOULD make you re-sad.  So, stop breaking up.  It sucks and you shouldn't have to go through it.  

So when Dr. Von Flushenheimer, or whoever, invented the urinal cake, I'm pretty sure they designed it with enough potentcy that one urinal cake would be adequate per urinal.  Now, I don't know if the Greeks are bad at math (even though they invented trigonometry) or if they just don't understand other languages (Von Flushenheimer is cleary German), but they don't seem to think that way at all.  They seem to think that at the Suffolk Diner in Centereach, NY you need eleven.  11!  Eleven fucking urinal cakes in one stall.  The 1:1 ratio was not acceptable to them and they said "Fuck the Germans, I want 11 of those bastards in there.  That'll learn 'em".  But really, was eleven urinal cakes that necessary?  Guys in Centereach are grimy, but goddamn.  And this is why I hate the Greeks.  Goat cheese ::shakes head::  

Wow, this post sucks.  Oops.  Night, fuckasses.

So, I definitely found a used urine sample drug test at work.  I'm doing an overnight, it's like 1:30 in the morning and I'm cleaning the bathroom.  Sweep--->mop--->mirror--->garbage....wait, something is amiss.  The little swinging door is being propped open by something.  So I reach in, pull it out, and it a urine sample cup.  I know this because the top said "Urine Sample Cup".  It also had a list of various drugs with three dots next to each name.  Whoever this person is was very drug free.  No MARI, or BARB, or COC, or AMPH.  Nothing.  This person was clean as a whistle (which I have NEVER understood.  Whistles are like spit traps that you can't drain.  Do you know how many nasty ass mouths have been on whistles, or how many times they've been dropped in the dirt, or if the person whistling brushed their teeth or not??  Clean as a whistle my ass.  More like clean as the skank ass ho blowing into it.), or at least their friend is.   Three nights later I found another one of the same cup.  This brings me to two conclusions: 1) Someone's on parole and their PO wants to meet at Starbucks to have them pee in a cup.  Or, 2) Some pothead douche is going to be getting drug tested for a new job and is screening which one of his friend's urine's is the best to use.  Either way, gross.

I love girls and they love me back.  No story.  Just wanted to say that.

Driving home the other night I was the only person on Sunrise [Highway] for 9 exits.  Literally the only pair of headlights for the whole span of time.  And this was around 11pm Saturday night.  Isn't that strange?
Yesterday, I went to the gym for the first time in weeks.  I get there, weigh myself, change, and realize that I left ONE sneaker on my bed 25 minutes away.  ::disgusted scoff::

Tonight, on Middle Country Road, here in Selden, NY, someone hit a telephone poll at around 6pm.  The result: no overnight shift for Kai!  The inadvertent result: I'll be up all night because I slept all day in preparation for being up all night.  Yayyyyyy!!  Oh wait, that's nothing to be excited about.

I've never thought of myself as a spontaneous person, but I had a conversation tonight that changed my mind.  I tend to overthink things.  If anything I consider that my character flaw (that and my large, large penis).  To combat myself overthinking things I try not to think about things too much.  Sometimes, it gets me onto trouble.  But most times, it allows me to have fun, because I'm doing things on the fly.  I have to say, I'm a fan.  Because of my "spontaneity" I have [practically] gotten a tugjob on the dance floor at a major university, thwarted security and the NYPD by breaking into a different university, ridden the train for free in Buffalo for the entire summer of 2002, broken into and vandalized Islip middle or high school (I can't remember which one) after witnessing a robbery from the roof of the South Shore mall, hooked up at work, and done the dirty at my high school.  See what happens when you don't overthink things?  Sex and crime!

So, starting April 1, I will no longer be one America's 46 million without health insurance.  ::holds for applause::  Yeah, I'm excited too.  I've already called my PCP and made an appointment for...tadaa, April 1.  I'm going to get every test done they have.  Mumps, measles, rubella, herpes, prostate, pregnancy, alzheimer's, over-active bladder, EVERYTHING.  I want to be fit for a diaphragm and everything.  It's going to be marvelous.  I'm going to walk out of that office with sore, swollen, puffy arms and it will be so sweet I'll probably get diabetes.  But don't worry, I'm getting tested for that too ::wink::

Ok, so last week I'm checking my mail (yippiekaia@gmail.com) and all of a sudden everything starts flashing orange and I thought I broke Gmail.  Turns out Google intergrated GoogleChat with Gmail so you can send IM's through your e-mail.  It's incredible.  Steve (I'd link his LiveJournal, but I don't think he has one) was the aforementioned IMer.  I was so confused.  Oh, and it does the coolest thing.  In AIM you can send smiley's and they're all cute and what not, but in Gmail they're animated!  They move!  I sent a smiley face :) and it rotated 90 degrees clockwise.  It was incredible.  Then I sent a wink ;) and it also rotated, but then IT WINKED.  I could not possibly express my enthusiasm through words, but let's just say I jizzed more in that 3 minutes than I have in the past year.  Ok, maybe not the past year, more like the past 10 months ::wink::  If you would like to get down with Gmail, I have 49 invitations left.  It sure beats whatever crap e-mail you have.  It winked people.  WINKED!!

P.S. Should I add a picture? And if so, does anybody have any good pictures of me?

And on that note, I'm out.  Why? I have no idea, I'll be up until at least 7am.  Meh.  Night, bitches.
Does anyone know if it's "sea foam green", or "sea-foam green"?  This may be the one thing the Internet is useless in answering.

I should read my friends page more.  It's kind of hypocritical of me.  I expect everyone to read my page,but I never, ever EVER read anyone else's.  I should get on that.  I just did a quick little scan, and in the past week Kiera has gotten all intelligent and verbose, Durin wishes this lady at work died, Katie Korb actually posted, Derek works for American Idol ::gag::, and Lindsay's depressed.  The things you learn by clicking a simple link...

I just watched Sympathy for Mr. Vengance.  I Netflix'd it because I read in Maxim that the director is known for over-the-top gory movies.  The first hour or so went by with nothing at all gory.  It was confusing as all fuck, but not gory.  Then all of a sudden, and guy starts slicing his own stomach open, you hear the sounds of an autopsy (twice), TWO people get their heads bashed in with baseball bats, a guy gets stabbed in the jugular with a screwdriver and pulls it out to cause the GREASTEST spray of blood I have ever seen, and for a grand finale, the protagonist gets his Achilles tendons sliced which forces him to crumple and drown in a 4-foot deep lake.   All of this in 45 minutes.  And I left out all the suicides, drownings, battery torture, necrophilia, and other buttery goodness.  Turns out that Chan-wook Park made a trilogy of sorts.  Part II is in the DVD player waiting for me to come home tonight.  Part III is in theaters May 5.

Yesterday, I told someone that "wonderousness" is an actual word and believed that with every fiber of my being.  I even looked it up.  ::shakes head::

So right this second I think I'm supposed to be at work.  Jill Schombs asked if I could cover the last 2 hours of her party, I agreed (for $20 ::cha ching::) and that was that.  Then she said we should just switch parties.  Then she said she'd call to confirm.  I gots no call, no IM, no nothing.  So I decided that we switched.  And since I haven't gotten a call from Craptain Bill's yet (see what I did there??) I assume that I assumed correctly.  If not, I guess I'm fired.  Darn..

You know what's not delicious?  Egg salad, especially in sandwich form.  First of all, it's yellow and has chunks of white in it.  Second...I don't know, it's just gross.  I had one last night/this morning and SWEAR I could taste the diarrhea forming.  Dramatic?  Yes, but that's how fucking gross egg salad is.  Now chicken salad... mmm mmm MMM!  Mr. Platnick was correct, that shit is good.

I should probably go shave now.  I'm looking all sorts of hairy.  Hairy=gross.  In 10 or more minutes a clean-saven Kai will emerge onto society and bring joy into people's lives.  And then I'll step inside Captain Bill's and want to murder everything I see.  Ciao!

I had a lengthly conversation yesterday with some ladies at work as to their initial thoughts of me.  All three thought I was gay (surprise).  And then I opened my mouth.  And now one of the three has admitted (although I am not supposed to know this) to wanting "it" from me.  And apparently the numbre rises everyday.  I so win.

Peace in the Middle East, y'all.

Ok, so not so much an addendum, I just wanted to use that word.  I am enamored with that word.

- The site in question from the last post is http://www.galaktek.com/.  It is fucking hilarious.  I promise.

- I did not, in fact, "find" said site.  It was sent to me by one April A. Johnson (Bupbeephee).

     - She also made me add this addendum,  with her "womanly powers".

          - Ok, so she just asked me to.  I'm so weak.  ::shakes head::

- My prediction did not come true.  I figured that 4 of you would ask for the site, just to be dicks.  No one did.  Clearly I have no friends/loyal readers/life.

Have a good day, JERKS!

Ok, I found this page online and it's hilarious.  Like laugh out loud, close your door so your housemates don't hear you laughing so hard funny.  And I want to share it with you guys.  Herein lies my diemma.  It's funny.  Really funny.  TOO funny.  If I show it to you, you'll abandon my page and I'll just by another lonlely LiveJournal loser.  So, here's what I will do - if you want to know what the page is, I'll tell you.  All you have to do is IM me (See, I already win!  NO ONE is going to IM me just to get a link.  Half the people who read this probably don't even have my screen name.  Man, I am a genius.)*

Forums crack me up.  When I was younger I belonged to a couple.  I think one was for Nine Days.  In college I joined some sex one under the moniker "CunningLinguist" (god, I love me).  Today, I scan the ones on IMDb, and I think it's hilarious.  All these people spend valuable time yelling at someone else because they spelled "remarcable" wrong and think that final destination 2 was the best thriller of all time.  They'll get into hardcore, 8-reply threads just straight up insulting each other.  Oh man, my favorite is when someone goes to the message board for a particular movie and pretends to be the star of the movie and then 4,000 chumps **believe them and get all excited that Will Ferrell actually checks his own message board.  Priceless.  It really is a fantastic way to spend some time.  Go find a random site, register, and just troll the forums.  You will find that some people have WAAAAAYYY too much time on their hands.  ESPECIALLY on IMDb.

I've decided today that I would use the word "enamored" every, sinlgle day.  This may be the best idea in all of 2006.  Next to the guy that said "I should fuck every bitch in the world."  Now that right there is just a fundamentally sound idea
.
Goodnight, lovers.




































* I have a prediction about this.  I'll let you know next post.
**edited on 3/1/06 (fuck you, alex.)

Ok, are they changing the LiveJournal site everyday?  I seem to be shocked on a daily basis now.  Silly internet companies.

Is it just me, or do the 90's not seem that long ago?  I'm watching Premium Blend right now and they're showing a stand-up bit from 1999.  I saw the year and immediately thought about the beginning of senior year, and the end of junior year, and my last Lynn Clark show, and asking Jess out, and all sorts of other things that happened in 1999.  Then I thought "well, that wasn' t that long ago.  Then I realized that week from today will be March 1, 2006, making 1999 7 fucking years ago?!??  Really??  I mean, I know we all went to college, or got engaged, or moved, or got a job, but 1999 does not seem like 7 years ago.  I know I'm twenty-three, but am I really, in all actuality, old?

This morning while at work, at 3:35am and 35 seconds, I tasted a Krispy Kreme donut.  The weird part is I was straightening chairs, thinking about stuff, and there wasn't a single donut on the premises.  I wasn't eating anything sugary, nor had I kissed anyone who recently had confections.  The reason I know the exact time was because it was so random.  I'm standing there and I started to smack my lips and feel happy.  The taste was there, unmistakable.  It was definitely a Kripy Kreme glazed donut, and day-old one, not one of the fresh-out-the-oven jammies.   I have no idea what it means.

So I really like working at Starbucks.  I do the overnights (mostly) so I don't get to deal with people too much, but I do get to spend 5-6 hours locked in a building with a co-worker.  I really like all of them so far.  Very friendly people, helpful, funny, and some are as perverted as me. OK, never in a fapillion years, but you get the point.   The other day orgasms were discussed (I still haven't seen Darlene since then.  That's not true, I saw her in Eckerd, but she didn't see me) and now with a new flock of people strap-ons and doggystyle was the topic.  So strange.  I've NEVER been around a group of people so open about sex like this.  I...like it.  Most of you chumps have sex but never really talk about it.  These people are like "I love it when a guy pulls my hair and pushes me hard into the wall".  P.S. That's what's up.  Hmm, I don't know where I'm going with this one.  Just strange that this random assortment of people always seem to be talking about doin' it.  My only thing with it is a lot of the people don't look like they've ever had sex.  Or that they "have sex" and that's it.  No spark, no pizzaz.  I find myself not exactly believing their stories.  But if I met me and I told me some of the things I've done I wouldn't believe me either.  Anyway, Starbucks is cool.

I was really confident tonight.  Working drive-thru you're supposed to schmooze the people a little bit, but I was full on flirting.  Like for real.  And for no reason.  I left Craptain Bill's (get it??) really angry and all of a sudden I was cracking jokes, making everyone smile.  Classic "Kai as the Center of Attention".  Something about that place makes me happy.  Weird.  Oh, and I saw a girls panties tonight.  Not on purpose.  She was a drive-thru customer and her car was low enough that I had to look down to see her face.  And there they were, lacy black panties.  She was wearing a skirt and I guess when she sat down it rode up or something.  I was INCHES from saying something, but that would've been creepy (kinda like this post?).  If I were in my car and my nut was hanging out I'd like someone to say something.  Back to me being.. um, yeah, let's just change the topic to anything. Anything at all. 

I got a text from Zeke (Kenny Rogers) today saying that he woke up on his left nut and he was pretty sure it was done for.  There's a story, but I pretty much just wanted to let you know that Kenny Rogers tried to give himself "The Stranger" and it went horribly awry.  (Ok, I just looked up "awry" to check the spelling and the definition the dict.org gives me is:  Awry \A*wry"\ ([.a]*r[imac]"), adv. & a. [Pref. a- + wry.]
     1. Turned or twisted toward one side; not in a straight or
        true direction, or position; out of the right course
Could that word be any more apropos to this situation??)

Tonight was Bay Shore High School's senior banquet and apparently I know everyone there still. Moreover, I know every female there. I was behind the bar (I NEVER want to even hear the words "shirley temple" again) and had, at least, 5 girls felt the need to greet me with "Kaaaaaiiiiii!! Heeeeeeeyyy!", and then give me a hug. Normally, I wouldn't care, but I was at work. One or two are exaplainable; my sister's their age. But 5+ 17-year-old girls being excited to hug you and hanging around the bar... may look a little sketchy. It's weird how far back my ties in Bay Shore go. These kids are 6 years younger than me. And I still know kids that are freshman! When I was in high school the oldest person I knew was my grandma. How do I know all these people? I guess drama. And I worked at the middle school for 2-ish years. I guess that explains it. But now everyone at work thinks I'm a child molester. Meh. Night, law-abiding citizens.
I really wanted to post tonight, but I am very, very, VERY tired.  I'll post in the afternoon.  Maybe.  Leave me a post though.  No one every comments anymore.  ::tear::

You ever think something is going one way and you're very pleased with it then all of a sudden something happens and an alternate reality pops in your head and turns everything upside down?  Example: You live your life, with your house, and your family, and your dog, and then one day you're watching a movie where the main character is adopted and you go home and realize that you yourself were adopted.  I not going through anything remotely close to being that dramatic, but all of a sudden today I was like: "::GASP::"  Still trying to sort things out.  If it turns out I'm right, I am totally ok.  I'm ok with either reality.  Yeah for being a grown up.

So I have my promotion interview today.  I'm kinda nervous.  If I don't get I won't be disappointed.  I mean, I've only been there a month and the raise isn't that significant.  But if I do get it I hope it will be a sign of things to come.  That reminds me, I played the Mega-Millions the other day.  It was at 102 million.  I should check the ticket to see if I won.  Anyway, wish me luck.  Hopefully the next time we speak you'll be calling me Shift Supervisor McNeil, rather than PimpMack Daddy of the Milennium McNeil.  You know, like you usually do.

So what would you do if you won 102 million dollars?  Most people would say they'd buy a rediculously expensive car, 3 or 4 houses, and take vacations forever.  In all honestly I would do none of those.  Ok, that was a lie.  I would buy 3 or 4 houses, but it'd be an investment.  I'd buy decent houses, fix them up, and rent them out to non-shady characters.  And since I would've bought the whole cash, their rent would pretty much be 100% profit.  Best case scenario, I could live off the rent.  Man, this is the best plan ever.  Car wise?  I'd sell this one to someone who needs it (Andrew) and prolly get a Chrysler 300C.  I know it a Chrysler, but have you seen that car?  Yes, I'd get 20's and tints and a system, but if you drive that car without any of those things you'd be a herb.  The VERY first thing I would do is get a copy of my credit report, whip out my checkbook, and start ripping off some checks.  Then I'd call NYU and tell them if they let me in I'll donate 1 mil to the university.  Then I'd buy a nice, 2 bedroom loft in Manhattan (another sound investment), set some money aside for Kiera's college, throw a nice chunk into a mutual fund or two and chill while my life took shape.  This was supposed to be a secret, but I'd also get my my friends things they needed.  A car, an apartment, and MCAT class.  I consider myself very alone most of the time, but I have people in my life who've been there for me when I needed it most.  I've never been able to repay them in a way I saw fit.  Maybe 102 mil can help me achieve that.

This is why Derek Karl Heck is a jerk:

Read the post from January 24.  I never finished it and made it private, but it is now completed and pimptacular.  Yup, I said it.

The single greatest thing to happen to me today was the introduction of Cash Cab into my life.  Have you seen it?  Hosted by Ben Bailey (a very funny stand-up comedian), it's the best show EVER.  You get in a NYC cab (always a minivan) and these lights and sirens go off.  You have just entered the Cash Cab.  For the duration of your ride you are asked questions ranging in point value from $25 to $100.  But wait: there's more.  If you're lucky enough to stop at a red light it triggers a RED LIGHT CHALLENGE!!!  That's worth $50 per answer and an extra $250 if you name them all.  And of course, there's a down side.  If you get three questions wrong you get no money, AND they kick you out of the cab, whether you're at your destination or not.  Today I saw a guy win $1225 and get his third question wrong as they're pulling up to his destination. Cash Cab rocks my life. Weeknights @6 and 6:30 on Discovery. I promise you will love it.

I LOVE the new incarnation of the GEICO commercials. "It's like pie...wif chips". The way he says it is so definitive. I look forward to seeing those commercials everytime I watch tv. I mean, who doesn't love pie? I don't really get the whole chips thing. Last time I checked, chips, in England, were French fries. I would never eat pie and French fries together, but that's not important. What is important is that I wish I had an awesome fake British accent like that smelly gecko.

I go to drop off some shirts at the cleaners.  I've been there before and the [Asian] lady is always all smiles and slight bows.  So I drop the shirts on the counter and she takes my info for the ticket.

"Kai?  That's nice Chinese name ::slight bow::"
    "Kai is Chinese?  I think I've heard that before.  I thought it was Hawaiian.  What does it mean?"
"Kai...it means... it's 'nice'"
    "Oh cool!"

So I'm really happy at this point.  I like learning new things, especially about my name.  Then she looks down at my license (I layed it on the counter to get money out) and she says "Oh, nice picture! You lose weight?"

This bitch just called me fat!  My license picture is abnormally close up, so I do look a little stocky in it.  But for her to assume that I was a fatty and lost weight...that hurt my feelings.  I went from "Oh, this lady is pretty cool", to, "Lousy immigrants" in 8 seconds.  I officially hate the _____ese (I'll fill this in later when I find out what she is.  I'd assume Chinese, but that'd be insensitive).

I know for a fact I had a lot more to say but now I can't remember shit.  Oh well.  I'll just leave you with the anti-asian racist banter.  Night, ::insert racial slur here::
I just realized I haven't bitten my fingernails in 4 days.  Horray for me!

Lisa Loeb, I will date you!  Why don't you see that?  What don't you understand about this?  You have this new reality show (#1 Single on VH1) where you try to find a boyfriend.  Hello??!?!?!  I'm right here!  Single as hell, and waiting for your call.  You know, not to be creepy or nothing, but you're the reason I LOVE girls who wear thick-rimmed glasses.  And because of that I will date you.  631-383-6547.  Do it.

It's 3am and I am not even remotely tired.  This sucks.  I wish ANYONE was up right now.  I here right now.  Hell, I'd even let Chad over (burn).  And now I'm bored.  That was fast.

So I realized that I may have jumped the gun with Ms. Loeb.  I looked the show up on IMDb and it's not listed.  But it is called #1 Single, and she is a singer/songwrite who releases singles.  So maybe, MAYBE it's about her making a new album, but it's probably about her dating some douchebag Hollywood-types and then ending up with me.  Man, I can't WAIT!

This post sucked.  I do apologize.  Night, bitches.

I had an interesting conversation with Bill about me and girls.  He shed some light on things, most of them I already knew.  But he did get me thinking.  Why do women like assholes?  You want to change them and make them decent and there's a good person under there and blah blah blah.  It's very self-destructive, masochistic behavior.  You knew he was a dick after you blew him and he didn't call you for 2 weeks, what makes you think you can "change" him?  And you're only going to "change" him into the submissive, good boyfriend, who buy flowers for no reason and tells you you're smart instead of hot, and who remembers you don't like capers. This new boyfriend will be just like that guy you met at the supermarket, but that guy's niceness was unattractive.  And then you wonder why you're 27 and have a long list of douchebag boyfriends.  So, so confusing.

Guy's aren't too much better.  We want girls who grab our cocks and say "Fuck me.  Now.", but god forbid she's slept with more than 5 guys.  Then she's a whore.  We want slutty girls, who aren't slutty.  She's either gonna have 20 bodies on her, or she's gonna be pretty unexperienced.  Can't have it both ways.  We are better though.  We definitely do play mind games, but we're not so much with the little tests.  If you ask what color shirt you were wearing when you first met, and he doesn't remember, it's NOT the end of the world.  He doesn't remember because it was 13 months ago and he shouldn't have to.  That simple.

I kinda want to talk about cheating now, but that's a WHOLE 'nother can of worms.  I claim that out of the majority of guys I know, I'm one of few who's never cheated.  And that's true.  Not like I never almost cheated, or never thought about it, but honestly, what's the point?  If you're with Susie, be with Susie.  Just because Mary is there, and is hot, and is all about your shit does not mean that you have to get with her.  You should've never let yourself get into the situation where she knew all about your shit in the first place.  No?

I have a toothache.  I'm pretty sure my wisdom tooth is trying to come in, but it's waiting til I have health insurance (circa 232 hours).  The second I get health insurance I'm slamming my arm in a car door, driving to the hospital, and screaming "Fix me, bitch!".  Then I'm gonna file for worker's comp, and live like a fat cat.

Danielle is leaving for Italy Sunday.  I wish her all the best and safe travels and eat lots of buttery food and all that and come back soon because I will miss you like britney spears misses being skinny.

It's cold as shit in my house.  I hate it.  Hopefully when I wake up the heat will be working.

Night, all.

2005:

1) Was 2005 a good year for you? Let's see, I finally got over April, which is great.  A lot of friends made serious commitmets to their bfs/gfs.  But I couldn't get back to school this year and this is the brokest I've been since college.  So we'll say 2005 was alright.
2) What was your favorite moment of the year? I was told I was amazing a few hours ago.  That was pretty nice.
3) What was your least favorite moment of the year? Getting my car impounded.  Easily the worst part.
4) Where were you when 2005 began? At Captain Bill's fine dining restaurant.
5) Who were you with? I don't even remember who was working, but there were a lot of rich NON-tippers there.  Jerks..
6) Where will you be when 2005 ends? At Climax in NYC drinking champagne like a champ.  Get it??
7) Who will you be with when 2005 ends? From what I know?  Andrew, Sean and Tim Foley, Karen, Jodi, maybe Ryan Risco.  Supposedly there are 20 of us, so who the fuck knows who's showing up?
8) Did you keep your new years resolution of 2005? If I made one it probably has something to do with my penis.  So, no.
9) Do you have a new years resolution for 2006? Stop taking shit and get shit done.
10) Did you fall in love in 2005? No.
11) If yes, with who? n/a
12) If yes, do they know? (see above)
13) Are you still in love with them? Enough with the love questions!
14) You regret it? Shut up.
15) Did you breakup with anyone in 2005? Fortuantely, no.
16) Did you make any new friends in 2005? Yup!  A bunch actually.  Lost some too.  Oh well, dem's the breaks.
17) Who are your favorite new friends? I got to know Chad a little better, and I met some Emily chick.  She's alright.
18) What was your favorite month of 2005? DEFINITELY not any of the summer months.  I'll go with December.
19) Did you travel outside of the US in 2005? I haven't left the country (cept for Canada) since I was 8.
20) How many different states did you travel to in 2005? I took a wrong turn and ended up in Connecticut once.  And Jersey to get to Jamie's.
21) Did you lose anybody close to you in 2005? My mom.  She didn't die or anything.  Enough was enough.  And April and I completely stopped talking.
22) Did you miss anybody in the past year? Kiera, April, Andrew (when he was gone), and Jamie.  It was almost a whole year between visits.
23) What was your favorite movie that you saw in 2005? Crash.  If you haven't seen it yet, NetFlix it immediately.
24) What was your favorite song from 2005? Pretty much anything by Death Cab For Cutie, even though I've only been listening to them for a week.
25) What was your favorite record from 2005? Van Hunt - Van Hunt
26) How many concerts did you see in 2005? Guster, Coldplay.  I think there was someone else, but I can't remember.
27) Did you have a favorite concert in 2005? Between the two?  Coldplay.  That Chris Martin is one bouncy fool.
28) Did you drink a lot of alcohol in 2005? No, but when I drank, I fucking drank.
29) Did you do a lot of drugs in 2005? The last drug I did was Prednisone when I had Bell's Palsy.  I wish I had the brains to start working out when I was on that.
31) Did you do anything you are ashamed of this year? Got with your mom.
32) How was your sex life in 2005? Started off real well, took the back burner for a few months, a one night stand, more back burner, and now it's all giggities and goos.
33) What was the worst lie someone told you in 2005? "I still care about you."
34) Did you treat somebody badly in 2005? I hope not.
35) Did somebody treat you badly in 2005? jesus, parents, bosses, friends.  So, yes.
36) How much money did you spend in 2005? Every penny I managed to save (about $16.23) was spent.  Mostly on the car(s).
37) What was your proudest moment of 2005? September 15, 2005 - I got MY car that I won back from "the man".
38) What was your most embarrassing moment of 2005? Walking and/or showing up for work in a cab for 2 months.
39) If you could go back in time to any moment of 2005 and change something, what would it be? I would NOT have driven up to see Andrew in March.
40) What are your plans for 2006? To fuck bitches and hit switches.  Wait, that was my resolution for 2005!

So it seems that I'm definitely going into the city for New Years.  I think a few years ago I vowed that I'd never go to the city for New Years cuz it's always so cold and crowded, but I can revoke said vow because I'll be INDOORS.  No snow, no pushing my way to the MTV window to see  Usher wave to the crowd, no smelly, way too happy foreigners.  I think I win.  And if everone is not making empty promises, there's gonna be a good 15-20 of us.  AT OUR VERY OWN VIP TABLE, BITCHES!!  Sorry, I didn't mean to yell, I just wanted to make sure you heard that part.  The final choice seems to be Climax, which is a nightclub.  've never heard of it, but tonight, when telling people I was "spending New Years at Climax in The City" everyone seemed really impressed.  Like I was spending it at Dick Clark's house or something.  Hmm, that doesn't make any sense.  Dick Clark's house will be very empty December 31.  His boyfriend might be there, but most likely he'll be in the green room chilling with his appletini.  Anyway, I am looking forward to having a good time.  There might be room, so if you're interested (and you have titties) holler at your boy.

I've never had a real good New Years.  That's not true, I did once.  December 31, 2003 was a great one.  April and I spent it at a hotel and we came, together, at midnight.  I swear to God (I even capitalized God! I MUST be telling the truth.) I haven't told many people that because it seems so unlikely, but it really happened.  She came right at 12 and I was maybe 12 and 40 seconds.  It was like "3!!!  2!!!  1!!! ::moan::"  It was the most ridiculous thing ever.  I'm still really impressed with us.  Good job, April.  But besides that, they've all sucked.  Last year I worked and only made $150 (I was told it'd be more like $300), the year before that.... I can't even remember.  What the shit did I do?  Oh, I'm a dick.  I just told you.  The year before that I was with college people in the Bronx.  That's the first time I had a martini.  Wow, I was barely drinking back then.  Weird.  Anyway, I hope this New Years is awesome.  I still have no one to kiss, but maybe there'll be some cheap floosie who digs black guys.  I hope not.  I guess I'll just have to just make out with my 3 bottles of champagne!!!!  Again, sorry for the yelling.  Just trying to rub it in.

Oh my lord, I have General Tso's just chilling in my fridge.  I must remedy this immediately.

Ok, back.  By the way, this was the best idea I've ever had in my life.  Ok, not true.  Buying this Chinese food 2 days ago and letting it age to perfection was the best idea ever.  God, the insight.  I love me.  But more importantly, I love General Tso, his delicious sauce, and brown rice.  And chopsticks.  Cuz forks are for jerks.

I've decided to start spelling "ridiculous" the correct way (Happy, Jamie??).  Even though I still believe that I am right, no one seems to be jumping on the bandwagon.  It's okay thought, cuz I have plenty more.  There's the Steak and Blowjob Day wagon, the Spanksgiving wagon, the Thanksgiving steak instead of turkey wagon, and the ginger ale and bitters wagon.  Jump on now, because one of these days the wagon is going to be FULL (like me after this last bite of General Tso's delicious bird meat).  Night, sluts.

You know what's weird?  I want to do more of those surveys.  Like all the time.  I want to be that annoying co-worker that sends a "funny" political joke to you everyday and crowds your inbox.  I want surveys.  Send them to me!  I NEEDS 'EM!  Pwease?  ::sad face::

impressions...
x. my father thinks i am = Ungrateful I would imagine.
x. my mother thinks i am = Hopefully? Dead.
x. my sibling thinks i am = A great brother who cares about her very, very much.
x. my grandma thinks i am = Neither of them are still with us.
x. my grandpa thinks i am = After 5 years of not seeing me, a grown man.
x. my boyfriend/girlfriend thinks i am = I don't have one, but she thinks I'm great to her.
x. my best friend thinks I am = A loser that doesn't want to drink.
x. three worst qualities = I'm poor, I'm a hopeless romantic, and I keep my mouth shut when I don't want to.
x. three things you are often complimented for= My dimple (singular), my ass (tis true), my humor.
x. a compliment you got that made you blush = "You're numbers 1, 2, and 3 on the list" (the list being best lovers you ever had)
x. you get embarrassed when = People see my house, people ask me how school is going.
x. makes you happy = Kissing, cuddling, working, wheat bread, and waffles.
x. upsets you = Lately?  Ex-girlfriends and bosses.

yes or no. ..
x you keep a diary = I guess you'd be reading it right now.  But it's JOURNAL, not a diary. Diaries are for girls. ::flexes::
x you like to cook = If I knew how I'd be all over it (like I'm all over your mom).
x you have a secret you have not shared with anyone = Of course.
x you fold your underwear = No, but the lady at the laundromat does (so does your mom)
x you talk in your sleep = Nope (but your mom does.  She calls me "papi").
x you set your watch a few minutes ahead = The clock in my room is 9 minutes fast, but I know that and just do things 9 minutes later.
x you bite your fingernails = I haven't in about 2 weeks.  Listen, that's HUGE for me.
x you believe in love = Yes, yes, and yes (that's also what your mom said last night, this morning, and during her lunch break).

last. ..
x. movie you rented = The Machinist.
x. movie you bought = High Fidelity
x. song you listened to = Brothers on a Hotel Bed - Death Cab For Cutie
x. song that was stuck in your head = The Last Polka - Ben Folds Five
x. CD you bought = I haven't a clue, but I was just given The John Mayer Trio CD and The Fray CD.
x. CD you listened to = From beginning to end?  Fly or Die - N*E*R*D*
x. person you've called = Linda at Progressive Insurance.  She was nice.
x. person that's called you = Jamie Perna.  And I forgot to call her back.  Oops!  Sorry Jimmy.
x. TV show you've watched = Nip/Tuck.
x. person you were thinking of = I think she knows who she is.


do. ..
x. you wish you could live somewhere else = Every fucking minute of the day.  I can't stand Selden.
x. you believe in online dating = It worked for someone I went to high school with, so I guess so.  I would never try it though.
x. others find you attractive = Every now and again I can trick someone into sleeping with me. 
x. you want more piercings = If I were bigger I'd get my nipple pierced, and it'd be my first.
x. you want more tattoos = No tats for me.  But if I did get one, it'd be a waffle maker on the inside of my bicep, and when I flex it closes and cooks the waffle and when I unflex the waffle is presented nicely on a plate with whipped cream and sliced strawberries.
x. you drink = Occasionally, and apparently that infrequency makes me a loser.
x. you do drugs = I think I got contact high at a Dave concert.  Does that count?
x. you smoke = Once in 7th grade.  NEVER again.

x. you like roller coasters = Love 'em.  It's been like 2 years though.  Let's plan a trip to Six Flags!

x. ever lied to someone = Not as much lately, but of course I have.  I was a teenager once.
x. ever been in a fist fight = Actually no.  Once in 7th grade a kid punched me in the ear.  I didn't even get the chance to swing back and somehow get detention.  He's now poor and has like 8 babies.  I win!

what. ..

x. perfume/cologne do you use = Cologne?  Pssh.  I'm au naturel, baby, and the ladies love it.
x. shoes do you wear = New Balances, Chuck Taylor's, Old Navy flip flops, Adidas, a pair Bill Blass square toed loafers, and Payless' for work.  And that'll get me through every occasion that'll ever, ever come up.  Silly girls.

x. of times I have had my heart broken? Twice.  The last time real, real bad.  But dem's the breaks.
x. of hearts I have broken? Prolly just one.  I'm pretty sure that I am responsible for her current mental status.
x. of boys I have kissed? Zero.

x. of CDs' that I own? Over a hundred.  Most of them are in mp3 form.

Ok, so Mike Shinoda, the "rapper" from Linkin Park, just dropped a solo album.  Seriously, why?  Linkin Park can still sell millions, but it has NOTHING TO DO WITH YOU, Shinoda.  You suck.  If anything, it's whiny Chester who makes the money come (but we all know it's really the DJ, Mr. Hahn.  He's the shit).You making a solo album is like fred "i banged slutty spears" durst making a solo album.  It's going to suck.  And do you know why?  Because you can't rap.  Yes, you can speak words melodically to a beat, but it is very far from rapping.  But wait, there's more.  Some very respected artists contributed to the album.  Common's on it (download Cold Blooded).  Kenna's on it (download anything by him.  He fucking rocks.).  Black Thought's on it (download Thought @ Work).  Fuckin Jay-Z produced it (download...shit, if you don't know anything by Jay-Z you are a leper).  But I am fully confident that this album will still suck.  If anyone listens to it, let me know.

juelz santana.... calm your short, wanna be Tupac ass down.  Out of your whole clique, your shit sold the least.  Then you come back hard with Mic Check, and it was hot.  But now... The Whistle Song??  I would bet copious amounts of money that there would be no Whistle Song if Ying Yang hadn't come out with The Whisper Song.  It's one thing to pretend you're a thug and a thief in your songs, but to actually steal... that's just fucked up, man.  Not cool.  Not cool.

ben kweller.  ::sigh::  It seems every year I accidentally see him in concert.  First, he opened for Dave in Cleveland.  Then, he appeared the Guster/Ben Folds concert.  Then last week, he shows up at the Guster concert again.  I was livid.  But if he opened for Dave, and knows Ben Folds and Guster there must be something cool about him.  That's when the bomb drops.  Guster has him sing and play guitar for I Hope Tomorrow Is Like Today. Again, livid.  What made it worse is his voice sounded eerily like the voice on the album.  But I quickly pushed that out of my mind, and tried not to bumrush the stage and kill him.  The next day, Chad texts me to say "kwellbones is all over Tomorrow Like Today".  Turns out he was right.  Not only did kweller sing on the album, but he wrote the song in 14 minutes AND played guitar and piano on the track.  He's like 18.  And he hangs out with Guster.  I love him, and I hate him.  The hate's winning, but if Guster, Folds, and Dave like him, I'll give him a shot.  But god help him if he lets me down.  He lives in Manhattan.  It's only 13 miles long.  I'll catch up to him eventually.

My very close and personal friend, Talib Kweli, is dropping an album, well today actually.  He just released The Beautiful Struggle last summer.  A year later, a brand new album.  The title - Right About Now: The Official Sucka Free Mix CD.  I'm poor, so I can't buy it, but if someone loooooves me...  In honor of this pleasant surprise (I wasn't expecting another album for 2 years) I've decided that I must expunge all the suckas from my life to make it sucka free.  So from here on in, I'm running a tight ship.  If I have ever called you a "sucka", "sucker", "suckA!", "chump", "bitch", or "herb", you are now dead to me (also dead to me: parents, credit cards, and bees).  I know this is abrupt, but I HAVE to be sucka free.  Suckas do nothing but get up all on your Kool-Aid, jump up to get beat down, and waste your flava.  But there is chance for redemption.  You can "unsuckafy" yourself, but I won't tell you how.  You'll have to earn it.  Put on your thinking caps, and get to work.  Here's your chance.  You can either shape up, or ship the fuck out.

Night, suckas.

Ok, so I've done it again.  Instead of Thanksgiving, I've created Spanksgiving.  It's like Thanksgiving, but instead of pilgrims and turkeys you smack the shit out of someone's ass.  Hop on board now, cuz this shit's taking over the globe.
So I just read my post from last night...and I am fucking HILARIOUS!  "I'm out like your boyfriend this Thanksgiving"?  That's goddamn brilliant.  Just thought I'd share that with you all.

Holy fucking shit.  Have you heard of Turducken?  It's a turkey, stuffed with a duck, stuffed with a chicken.  Yup.  Just fucking marinate on that for a while.

Ok, it's been 17 minutes, and while I'm sure that your mind has been completely and thoroughly BLOWN, I shall continue to post.  Turducken is, quite possibly, THE GREATEST THING TO EVER EXIST.  Forget sliced bread, fire, the Internet, automobiles, condoms, speech and language, cunnilingus, cement, plastic, cotton, microchips, and pie, it is ALL ABOUT Turducken.  I just found about it yesterday, so this Turkey Day is a bust, but next Thanksgiving, it is ON.  This could only get better if a) it somehow gave the eatee a blowjob, b) the succulent meat of a pig was somehow incorporated, or c) it somehow gave the eatee a blowjob.  To the brilliant creator of the Turducken, I appluad you*.

Saw Guster again on Friday.  Played Happier: check.  Played a single song from Parachute: nope.  Had a good seat: check.  Hot girls a plenty: check.   Played Jesus On The Radio:  nope.  Took place in the brand new, awesomely swanky Nokia Times Square Theater: check.  Had a fantastic time simply because it was Guster: check.  Had a fantastic time because I was there with Chad: not a chance in this cold, cruel world.  Their opener was some crappy band called Matt Pond PA.  I have no idead if you pronounce the "PA" as separate letters, as pa (as in grandpa), or whether it's supposed to stand for Pennsylvania.  I do have an idea as to whether they were awesome or not.  They weren't.  They fucking sucked.  Every song sounded the same, and just so you know, Matt, adding a cello to every song doesn't make you revolutionary.  It makes you a bitch.  Especially since we ALL knew that the girl playing the cello was some groupie who has dirt on you.  Or better yet, the daughter of the lady who got you the record deal.  You suck, and stop saying "fucking" so much.  There were 8-year-olds in the audience, schmuck.

What else?  Car's on the outs.  That's what I get for getting some.

I'm going to Marnie's house for Turkey Day.  While there will NOT be Turducken (lousy jews), there will be some delicious... umm, some delicious... ahhh, some of that... whatever the fuck jews eat for Thanksgiving.  Whatever it is, I am sure it will be both unleavened and tasty.

Just so you all know, I am incredible in bed.  I mean, Colin Farrell, Johnny Depp, Jude Law, and any other dirty, skinny bitches you can think of can't hold a flame to me.  That's cuz I'm on FIRE!  10 times, people.  Ten.  Tell your lame boyfriends to give me a call so I can teach him a thing or two about orgasms.  631.383.6547  Better yet, screw him and YOU call me.  I'll make it worth your while.  And worth your while.  And worth your while.  And worth your while...

Rosario Dawson is The Daily Show right now.  I'll be back in 5 minutes.  ::zip::

Hmm, I like this.  I think I'm going to start to post more often again.  God knows I'm going to have the time since my car is about to break and I won't be able to get to work.  I'm out like your boyfriend this Thanksgiving.  Night, ladies.

So I, once again, have a dilemma.  I downloaded (ILLEGALLY.  Come and get me RIAA!!!!) the first Jason Mraz cd.  I'm listening to it now for the first time, and I like it.  But it's kinda gay.  I heard that he was gay, but I don't mean it like he's gay, the music is gay.  Like if I was picking up a girl for a date and had this cd playing she'd ask who it was, and then when she got home tell her roommate, "He was listening to Jason Mraz.  What the fuck is that about?".  But I like the songs.  They're not great songs, but catchy.  I don't want to take anything away from him.  Not Tom's Diner ("doo-doo doo doo, doo-doo doo doo") catchy, but like I'm gonna go to sleep with all these songs in my head.  It's kinda young sounding, but I like it.  I guess this post was just an excuse for me to justify liking gay music.  I like Waiting For My Rocket To Come and I'm proud of it.  Now if I could only come to terms with my blatant homosexuality we'd be getting somewhere.  Night, homos.

I've never liked Halloween.  Not even as a kid when it was all
about getting candy.  Now, I may be partly biased.  When I
was in 7th grade, my "mother" decided that we, as a "family", were
jehovah's witnesses.  I know exactly what you're thinking, and
yes, it was just as much fun as it sounds.  Going to the kingdom
hall (it's what the call their church) 4 nights a week, 3 hours on
Sundays alone, having strangers come to your house and talk to you
about everlasting life, bible studies up the ass, and then the absolute
pleasure of not having a birthday, christmas, easter, or even freaking
Arbor Day.  They also believe that Halloween is in fact and evil
holiday.  So I haven't been out for Halloween since I was
12.  It always stuck me as kinda boring.  I get dressed up
and go ask the neighbors I don't talk to 364 days for candy. 
Plus, from the time ages 5 to 10 I was a vampire.  FOR EVERY
YEAR.  So I'm not a fan of Halloween.  I am, however, a fan
of the slutty costumes that have become the norm now.  I mean, who
doesn't love a big-tittied cop with handcuffs?  Anyway, Halloween
sucks.  Trick or treat, bitches.

So it has been quite a while since my last post.  This shall change.  But not tonight.  I'm too lazy, bitches.

I just went for walk in the rain.  It was incredible.  I drove out to some park in Wading River, and walked for a good 20 minutes.  Then I came home and sat in my car listening to the rain pound on the ceiling for another twenty minutes.  40 minutes of bliss, but I would gladly trade that in for 60 seconds of kissing in the rain.  Or an hour of cuddling under the blanket with the windows open.  Where are you?

Also, Jennifer Connelly (who was the guest when I saw Conan) AND Brian Regan are on tonight.  It's like god wanted me watch it.  God or the producers, whoever.

And speaking of god, I came upon the worst (READ: possibly best) site ever today.  loljesus.com.  I'm not going to make it a link.  If I did, and you clicked it, then technically I would be responsible for what you saw.  But since I only suggested the site, you have to manually type it in.  No court would convict me.  It might help if you speak "L337" (pronounced "leet").  It's short for elite.  It's the language computer nerds (sorry Derek.  and Steve.  and Erik.  and Ron.  and Op.) speak.  I know very little about it, I do know that the word "owned" is spelled "pwnt" because when typing, your pinky would naturally hit the "p" rather than the "o".  And multiple exclamation points (!!!!!!!!) are !!!!!!1!!, because sometimes people lay off the shift key.  All the pictures have some form of L337-speak.  Whatever.  By the way, don't say I didn't warn you.  The site is pretty blasphemous.  But then again, so am I.
